You'll get better answers if you include your craft files, but there are a ton of circumstances when you'd see virtually no movement.

One is if your rocket is going fairly fast through atmosphere. The aerodynamics of the rocket will tend to keep it going in a straight line. If you've got static (unmoving) fins on the rocket, that'll make this even more pronounced.

Another is if your rocket is very large and doesn't have control units on it, like SAS or RCS.

Obviously having both of those is worse.

Try starting sandbox game and finding an engine with high gimballing, add an SAS control unit and don't exceed 200 m/s in the lower atmosphere. If that doesn't work, you've got some serious bugginess. Otherwise, it's just a matter of getting used to aerodynamics.

Alright guys after I read your posts here, Ive made several tests and its DEFINETELY some sort of bug.

I ran the same ship over and over again the same exactly way, sometimes it triggers the bug where the torque stops using electricity, other times works fine.

For example: I press W and it uses electricity, and other times it doesn't use any electricity at all even though I keep pressing W A S D trying. (which is when it doesn't turn)

Just give one example that has the same symptom: if you lose probe control with RemoteTech mod because of no connection. There are so many different causes that can be easily distinguished by a picture but any text description is likely to lack necessary information (yours no exception).

So, without picture, we can only guess, and that may be completely irrelevant to your problem. Insisting it's a bug doesn't help at all. Even if you post in support forum, I believe it will get ignored unless you provide craft/picture.
